intro: Aeschynomene oroboides, commonly known as partridge pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a leguminous species belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Aeschynomene oroboides is also cultivated as a forage crop and for its ornamental value.
